Class StandardNodeSampler

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.sampling.interfaces.AbstractNodeSampler
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.sampling.standardsamplers.StandardNodeSampler
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMultiSowable
public class StandardNodeSampler extends AbstractNodeSampler
A standard implementation of the AbstractNodeSampler. Uses Normal distribution for node properties and Uniform distribution for random node selection. TODO-JIRA: De-POW-ify the Node Sampler classes in Engine. - Both this and the parent refer to PoW-style nodes. They must be renamed and more generic Node classes need to be introduced.
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

  • Constructor Details

    • StandardNodeSampler

      public StandardNodeSampler(Sampler s)
      Constructs a StandardNodeSampler using the specified Sampler. Initializes a new Random generator.
      Parameters:
      s - the Sampler to use for Gaussian sampling

    • StandardNodeSampler

      public StandardNodeSampler(Sampler s, long[] seedArray, boolean[] flagArray, int sim)
      Constructs a StandardNodeSampler using the specified Sampler and seed management configuration.
      Parameters:
      s - the Sampler to use for Gaussian sampling
      seedArray - array of seeds for reproducible random sequences
      flagArray - flags indicating whether each seed should be updated
      sim - the simulation ID for seed updates
      See Also:
      • SeedManager

  • Method Details

    • getNextMiningInterval

      public long getNextMiningInterval(double hashPower)
      Returns a sample of the mining interval in milliseconds for a node with the specified hash power and current difficulty.
      Specified by:
      getNextMiningInterval in class AbstractNodeSampler
      Parameters:
      hashPower - the node's hash power in Giga-hashes/second
      Returns:
      a sampled mining interval in milliseconds
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if hashPower is less than 0
      See Also:
      • AbstractNodeSampler.getNextMiningInterval(double)

    • getNextMiningIntervalTrials

      public double getNextMiningIntervalTrials(double difficulty)
      Get a random sample of the number of trials needed to successfully validate. Sampling formula is: Math.log(1-Math.random())/Math.log1p(- 1.0/difficulty))
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The difficulty under which the number of trials is generated.
      Returns:
      A number of trials needed for validation.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if difficulty is less than 0

    • getNextMiningIntervalMiliSeconds

      public double getNextMiningIntervalMiliSeconds(double hashPower, double difficulty)
      Returns a sample of the mining interval in milliseconds for a node with the specified hash power and difficulty.
      Parameters:
      hashPower - the node's hash power in Giga-hashes/second
      difficulty - the PoW difficulty
      Returns:
      a sampled mining interval in milliseconds
      See Also:
      • getNextMiningIntervalSeconds(double, double)

    • getNextNodeElectricPower

      public float getNextNodeElectricPower()
      Returns a random sample of the node's electric power (Watts) using a Normal distribution defined by AbstractNodeSampler.nodeElectricPowerMean and AbstractNodeSampler.nodeElectricPowerSD.
      Specified by:
      getNextNodeElectricPower in class AbstractNodeSampler
      Returns:
      a sampled electric power value (Watts)
      See Also:
      • AbstractNodeSampler.getNextNodeElectricPower()

    • getNextRandomNode

      public int getNextRandomNode(int nNodes)
      Returns a randomly selected node ID from the range [0, nNodes).

      Selection is uniform.

      Specified by:
      getNextRandomNode in class AbstractNodeSampler
      Parameters:
      nNodes - the total number of nodes
      Returns:
      a randomly selected node ID
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if nNodes is less than 1
      See Also:
      • AbstractNodeSampler.getNextRandomNode(int)

    • updateSeed

      public void updateSeed()
      Description copied from interface: IMultiSowable
      Update the seed for random number generation. Implementations should define how the seed is updated (e.g. based on a preset list of values).
      Specified by:
      updateSeed in interface IMultiSowable
      Specified by:
      updateSeed in class AbstractNodeSampler
